featured.title: Umbria
featured.subtitle: Italy's Green Heart
featured.description: Umbria is central Italy's best-kept secret. Positioned perfectly between Rome and Florence, this landlocked region offers what Tuscany used to be â€” affordable medieval hill towns, world-class truffles, Sagrantino wine, and a slower pace of life. No coastline means fewer tourists and more authentic Italian living.

newsletters.title: Veneto
newsletters.subtitle: The European Crossroads
newsletters.description: Beyond Venice's lagoon lies Italy's quiet powerhouse: Padova's world-class hospitals, Vicenza's Palladian elegance, Prosecco hills, Dolomite ski runs, and a rail network that puts Munich closer than Rome. This issue maps the mainland cities retirees actually live in, breaks down cost of living across a dozen towns, and explains why Veneto's infrastructure makes it Italy's most connected region.
